se.sics.assertionServer.databaseAccess
Interface DBConnector

All Known Implementing Classes:
SQLConnector
public interface DBConnector

This interface provides database connectivity methods for the Attribute Authority.

Author:
Ludwig Seitz

init

void init(java.lang.String rootPwd)
          throws java.sql.SQLException
Create the necessary database and tables. Requires the root user password.

Parameters:
rootPwd - the root user password

                    throws java.sql.SQLException

select

java.sql.ResultSet select(java.lang.String subject,
                          java.lang.String soa,
                          java.lang.String attrId,
                          java.lang.String dataType)
                          throws java.sql.SQLException
Do a retrieval of attribute values. This does either:
  • Retrieve a specific attribute for a subject, needs: subject, soa, attrId, dataType
  • Retrieve all attributes for a subject, needs: subject; rest is null
  • Retrieve all subjects and values for a specific attribute, needs: soa, attrId, dataType; subject is null.

Parameters:
subject - the subject of the attribute. If this is null, soa, attrId and dataType must not be null
soa - the Source Of Authority for the Attribute. If this is null, subject must not be null
attrId - the attribute identifier. If this is null, subject must not be null
dataType - the data type of the attribute. If this is null subject must not be null
Returns:
the results of the SELECT query
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException

selectDefs

java.sql.ResultSet selectDefs(java.lang.String soa,
                              java.lang.String attrId,
                              java.lang.String dataType)
                              throws java.sql.SQLException
Selects an attribute definition

Parameters:
soa - the Source Of Authority for the attribute
attrId - the attribute identifier
dataType - the data type of the attribute
Returns:
the results of the SELECT query
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException

                throws java.sql.SQLException

close

void close()
           throws java.sql.SQLException
Close the connections. After this any other method calls to this object will lead to an exception.

Throws:
java.sql.SQLException
